frame.name: Preventing_or_letting
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Potential_hindrance</fen> or an <fen>Agent</fen> (via their actions) keeps an <fen>Event</fen> from taking place, or despite the possibility of prevent the <fen>Event</fen>, do not do so. Lexical units which indicate that the event is not prevented, e.g. allow.v, are marked with the semantic type "Negative". Some lexical units, like <t>avert</t> and <t>avoid</t> indicate that the <fen>Potential_hindrance</fen> or <fen>Agent</fen> would have been affected if the <fen>Event</fen> occurred.
<ex> <fex name="Potential_hindrance">Rain</fex> <t>prevented</t> <fex name="Event">the ball game</fex> <fex name="Event">from taking place</fex>.</ex>
<ex> <fex name="Agent">He</fex> could have <t>stopped</t> <fex name="Event">the riot</fex> .</ex>
<ex> <fex name="Potential_hindrance">The government</fex> narrowly <t>averted</t> <fex name="Event">a coup</fex> . </ex> <ex><fex name="Potential_hindrance">She</fex> <t>allowed</t> <fex name="Event">more than a few mistakes</fex> <fex name="Event">to happen</fex> .</ex> <ex><fex name="Potential_hindrance">Technology</fex> has <t>permitted</t> <fex name="Event">firms</fex> <fex name="Event">to link together more closely</fex>.</ex> <ex>Unlike DOS , <fex name="Potential_hindrance">Windows</fex> <t>lets</t> <fex name="Event">you</fex> <fex name="Event">get on with something else</fex> <fex name="Time">when sending a fax</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Potential_hindrance">Liberalization</fex> <t>allows</t> <fex name="Event">easier entry into particular markets</fex> .</ex> <ex><fex name="Potential_hindrance">Mesh</fex> <t>allows</t> <fex name="Event">the water</fex> <fex name="Event">to circulate normally through the aquarium</fex>.</ex>
<ex></ex>
Unlike in the Thwarting frame, the <fen>Potential_hindrance</fen> or <fen>Agent</fen> does not directly prevent the actions of an individual, but rather affects the world in such a way that an <fen>Event</fen> cannot occur.</def-root>

FE.name: Potential_hindrance
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Potential_hindrance</fen> is the force which keeps the <fen>Event</fen> from happening, or does not.</def-root>

FE.name: Event
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Event</fen> is prevented from occurring by the <fen>Preventing_cause</fen> or the <fen>Agent</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Time</fen> is when the <fen>Potential_hindrance</fen> or <fen>Agent</fen> keeps the <fen>Event</fen> from taking place.</def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Place</fen> is where the <fen>Potential_hindrance</fen> or <fen>Agent</fen> keeps the <fen>Event</fen> from taking place.</def-root>

FE.name: Agent
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Agent</fen> is the sentient being which keeps the <fen>Event</fen> from happening.</def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>This frame element selects some gradable attribute and modifies the expected value for it.</def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition: <def-root>A situation that accompanies the preventing or allowing.</def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>Any description of details of the event that influence the overall understanding and impression, such as the attitude of an <fen>Agent</fen> (casually) or the overall nature of the event (the same way).</def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root>The action performed by an <fen>Agent</fen> that brings about the prevention or allowing.</def-root>

FE.name: Event_description
FE.definition:
<def-root>In general, this FE is used for phrases that describe the clause of the target as a whole. There are two somewhat distinct subgroups of sentence modifiers that cover this function.
First, it applies to appraisals of the event, typically a judgment of its expectedness. The notion of appraisal requires a factive portrayal of the event. The second subgroup consists of any descriptions of the state of affairs denoted by the target as role fillers in other frames. The state of affairs reported by the target is understood to play a role in the state of affairs of the modifier. What that role is depends only on the predicate heading the modifier phrase.</def-root>

FE.name: Depictive
FE.definition: <def-root>A description of the <fen>Agent</fen> or an entity of the <fen>Event</fen> while they are involved in the action.</def-root>

FE.name: Period_of_iterations
FE.definition: <def-root>The length of time from when the event denoted by the target began to be repeated to when it stopped.</def-root>

FE.name: Allowed_category
FE.definition:
<def-root>A category that the <fen>Event</fen> fits into, which dictates the <fen>Event</fen>'s being permitted or prevented (in accord with some implicit Principle.)
<ex>The transfer was <t>sanctioned</t> <fex name="Allowed_category">as a "necessary precaution"</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE denotes a proposition from which the main clause (headed by the target) logically follows. </def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition: <def-root>The situation that the <fen>Agent</fen> hopes to bring about with their action.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: afweren.v
lexUnit.definition: op een afstand houden, niet dichtbij laten komen

lexUnit.name: preventie.n
lexUnit.definition: om nare dingen, zoals brand, diefstal ed. te voorkomen
